env.name: ENV
env.description: The logical name of the deployment, must be unique across all environments using the same shared Kafka/Elasticsearch clusters, `a-z (any case)`, `0-9`, `-`, `_` symbols only allowed

env.name: DB_HOST
env.description: Postgres hostname

env.name: DB_PORT
env.description: Postgres port

env.name: DB_USERNAME
env.description: Postgres username

env.name: DB_PASSWORD
env.description: Postgres username password

env.name: DB_DATABASE
env.description: Postgres database name

env.name: DB_MAXPOOLSIZE
env.description: This property controls the maximum size that the pool is allowed to reach, including both idle and in-use connections

env.name: DB_MINIMUM_IDLE
env.description: This property controls the minimum number of idle connections that HikariCP tries to maintain in the pool

env.name: DB_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls the maximum number of milliseconds that a client will wait for a connection from the pool

env.name: DB_IDLE_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls the maximum amount of time that a connection is allowed to sit idle in the pool. This setting only applies when `DB_MINIMUM_IDLE` is defined to be less than `DB_MAXPOOLSIZE`

env.name: DB_KEEPALIVE_TIME
env.description: This property controls how frequently HikariCP will attempt to keep a connection alive, in order to prevent it from being timed out by the database or network infrastructure (0 - disabled)

env.name: DB_MAX_LIFETIME
env.description: This property controls the maximum lifetime of a connection in the pool

env.name: DB_VALIDATION_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls the maximum amount of time that a connection will be tested for aliveness. This value must be less than the `DB_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT`

env.name: DB_INITIALIZATION_FAIL_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls whether the pool will "fail fast" if the pool cannot be seeded with an initial connection successfully

env.name: DB_LEAK_DETECTION_THRESHOLD
env.description: This property controls the amount of time that a connection can be out of the pool before a message is logged indicating a possible connection leak (0 - disabled)

env.name: OKAPI_URL
env.description: Okapi URL

env.name: SYSTEM_USER_USERNAME
env.description: Username for system user

env.name: RECORDS_CHUNK_SIZE
env.description: Number of records in one chunk for operation processing

env.name: CHUNK_FETCH_IDS_COUNT
env.description: Number of record ids to fetch per query on chunks preparation phase. RECORDS_CHUNK_SIZE should be a divisor for this in order to maintain proper chunk size

env.name: CHUNK_RETRYING_MAX_IDS_COUNT
env.description: Maximum number of chunk IDs for retrying

env.name: CHUNK_PERSIST_COUNT
env.description: Number of chunks to be constructed before persisting to db

env.name: CHUNK_PROCESSING_MAX_PARALLELISM
env.description: Max thread pool size for chunks processing

env.name: S3_URL
env.description: S3 compatible service url

env.name: S3_REGION
env.description: S3 compatible service region

env.name: S3_BUCKET
env.description: S3 compatible service bucket

env.name: S3_ACCESS_KEY_ID
env.description: S3 compatible service access key

env.name: S3_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
env.description: S3 compatible service secret key

env.name: S3_IS_AWS
env.description: Specify if AWS S3 is used as files storage

env.name: S3_RETRY_COUNT
env.description: Specify number of retries if S3 client return any kind of error

env.name: S3_RETRY_DELAY_MS
env.description: Specify millisecond delay between retries if S3 client return any kind of error

env.name: ENV
env.description: The logical name of the deployment, must be unique across all environments using the same shared Kafka/Elasticsearch clusters, `a-z (any case)`, `0-9`, `-`, `_` symbols only allowed

env.name: DB_HOST
env.description: Postgres hostname

env.name: DB_PORT
env.description: Postgres port

env.name: DB_USERNAME
env.description: Postgres username

env.name: DB_PASSWORD
env.description: Postgres username password

env.name: DB_DATABASE
env.description: Postgres database name

env.name: DB_MAXPOOLSIZE
env.description: This property controls the maximum size that the pool is allowed to reach, including both idle and in-use connections

env.name: DB_MINIMUM_IDLE
env.description: This property controls the minimum number of idle connections that HikariCP tries to maintain in the pool

env.name: DB_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls the maximum number of milliseconds that a client will wait for a connection from the pool

env.name: DB_IDLE_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls the maximum amount of time that a connection is allowed to sit idle in the pool. This setting only applies when `DB_MINIMUM_IDLE` is defined to be less than `DB_MAXPOOLSIZE`

env.name: DB_KEEPALIVE_TIME
env.description: This property controls how frequently HikariCP will attempt to keep a connection alive, in order to prevent it from being timed out by the database or network infrastructure (0 - disabled)

env.name: DB_MAX_LIFETIME
env.description: This property controls the maximum lifetime of a connection in the pool

env.name: DB_VALIDATION_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls the maximum amount of time that a connection will be tested for aliveness. This value must be less than the `DB_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT`

env.name: DB_INITIALIZATION_FAIL_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls whether the pool will "fail fast" if the pool cannot be seeded with an initial connection successfully

env.name: DB_LEAK_DETECTION_THRESHOLD
env.description: This property controls the amount of time that a connection can be out of the pool before a message is logged indicating a possible connection leak (0 - disabled)

env.name: OKAPI_URL
env.description: Okapi URL

env.name: KAFKA_HOST
env.description: Kafka broker hostname

env.name: KAFKA_PORT
env.description: Kafka broker port

env.name: KAFKA_SECURITY_PROTOCOL
env.description: Kafka security protocol used to communicate with brokers (SSL or PLAINTEXT)

env.name: KAFKA_SSL_KEYSTORE_LOCATION
env.description: The location of the Kafka key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.

env.name: KAFKA_SSL_KEYSTORE_PASSWORD
env.description: The store password for the Kafka key store file. This is optional for client and only needed if 'ssl.keystore.location' is configured.

env.name: KAFKA_SSL_TRUSTSTORE_LOCATION
env.description: The location of the Kafka trust store file.

env.name: KAFKA_SSL_TRUSTSTORE_PASSWORD
env.description: The password for the Kafka trust store file. If a password is not set, trust store file configured will still be used, but integrity checking is disabled.

env.name: KAFKA_CONSUMER_MAX_POLL_RECORDS
env.description: Maximum number of records returned in a single call to poll().

env.name: KAFKA_AUTHORITY_SOURCE_FILE_TOPIC_PARTITIONS
env.description: Amount of partitions for `authority-authority-source-file` topic.

env.name: KAFKA_AUTHORITY_SOURCE_FILE_TOPIC_REPLICATION_FACTOR
env.description: Replication factor for `authority-authority-source-file` topic.

env.name: KAFKA_INSTANCE_AUTHORITY_TOPIC_PARTITIONS
env.description: Amount of partitions for `links.instance-authority` topic.

env.name: KAFKA_INSTANCE_AUTHORITY_TOPIC_REPLICATION_FACTOR
env.description: Replication factor for `links.instance-authority` topic.

env.name: KAFKA_INSTANCE_AUTHORITY_STATS_TOPIC_PARTITIONS
env.description: Amount of partitions for `links.instance-authority-stats` topic.

env.name: KAFKA_INSTANCE_AUTHORITY_STATS_TOPIC_REPLICATION_FACTOR
env.description: Replication factor for `links.instance-authority-stats` topic.

env.name: KAFKA_AUTHORITIES_CONSUMER_CONCURRENCY
env.description: Number of kafka concurrent threads for `inventory.authority` message consuming.

env.name: KAFKA_INSTANCE_AUTHORITY_STATS_CONSUMER_CONCURRENCY
env.description: Number of kafka concurrent threads for `links.instance-authority-stats` message consuming.

env.name: KAFKA_INSTANCE_AUTHORITY_CHANGE_PARTITIONS
env.description: Number of instance-authority links `links.instance-authority` event contains while processing authority link source change.

env.name: INSTANCE_STORAGE_QUERY_BATCH_SIZE
env.description: Number of instances to retrieve from inventory storage per one request (Max 90 - based on maximum URI length)

env.name: AUTHORITY_ARCHIVES_EXPIRATION_PERIOD
env.description: The retention period in days for keeping the deleted authorities in authority_archive DB table

env.name: DB_HOST
env.description: Postgres hostname

env.name: DB_PORT
env.description: Postgres port

env.name: DB_USERNAME
env.description: Postgres username

env.name: DB_PASSWORD
env.description: Postgres username password

env.name: DB_DATABASE
env.description: Postgres database name

env.name: DB_MAXPOOLSIZE
env.description: This property controls the maximum size that the pool is allowed to reach, including both idle and in-use connections

env.name: DB_MINIMUM_IDLE
env.description: This property controls the minimum number of idle connections that HikariCP tries to maintain in the pool

env.name: DB_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls the maximum number of milliseconds that a client will wait for a connection from the pool

env.name: DB_IDLE_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls the maximum amount of time that a connection is allowed to sit idle in the pool. This setting only applies when `DB_MINIMUM_IDLE` is defined to be less than `DB_MAXPOOLSIZE`

env.name: DB_KEEPALIVE_TIME
env.description: This property controls how frequently HikariCP will attempt to keep a connection alive, in order to prevent it from being timed out by the database or network infrastructure (0 - disabled)

env.name: DB_MAX_LIFETIME
env.description: This property controls the maximum lifetime of a connection in the pool

env.name: DB_VALIDATION_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls the maximum amount of time that a connection will be tested for aliveness. This value must be less than the `DB_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT`

env.name: DB_INITIALIZATION_FAIL_TIMEOUT
env.description: This property controls whether the pool will "fail fast" if the pool cannot be seeded with an initial connection successfully

env.name: DB_LEAK_DETECTION_THRESHOLD
env.description: This property controls the amount of time that a connection can be out of the pool before a message is logged indicating a possible connection leak (0 - disabled)

env.description: Specify if Elasticsearch request/response compression enabled

env.name: DB_HOST
env.description: Postgres hostname

env.name: DB_PORT
env.description: Postgres port

env.name: DB_USERNAME
env.description: Postgres username

env.name: DB_PASSWORD
env.description: Postgres username password

env.name: DB_DATABASE
env.description: Postgres database name

env.name: INDEXING_DATA_FORMAT
env.description: Format for passing data to elasticsearch (json/smile)

env.name: INSTANCE_CHILDREN_INDEX_ENABLED
env.description: Defines if module should process subjects/contributors/classifications/call-numbers in a background

env.name: INSTANCE_CHILDREN_INDEX_DELAY_MS
env.description: Scheduler delay for indexing subjects/contributors/classifications

env.name: INSTANCE_CHILDREN_INDEX_BATCH_SIZE
env.description: Batch size for indexing subjects/contributors/classifications

env.name: INITIAL_LANGUAGES
env.description: Comma separated list of languages for multilang fields

env.name: MAX_SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES
env.description: Provides the maximum number of supported languages

env.name: SYSTEM_USER_USERNAME
env.description: Username for `mod-search` system user

env.name: SYSTEM_USER_PASSWORD
env.description: Password for `mod-search` system user (not required for dev envs)

env.name: OKAPI_URL
env.description: OKAPI URL used to login system user, required

env.name: SEARCH_BY_ALL_FIELDS_ENABLED
env.description: Specifies if globally search by all field values must be enabled or not (tenant can override this setting)

env.name: BROWSE_CN_INTERMEDIATE_VALUES_ENABLED
env.description: Specifies if globally intermediate values (nested instance items) must be populated or not (tenant can override this setting)

env.name: BROWSE_CN_INTERMEDIATE_REMOVE_DUPLICATES
env.description: Specifies if globally intermediate duplicate values (fullCallNumber) should be removed or not (Active only with BROWSE_CN_INTERMEDIATE_VALUES_ENABLED)

env.name: SCROLL_QUERY_SIZE
env.description: The number of records to be loaded by each scroll query. 10_000 is a max value

env.name: STREAM_ID_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS
env.description: Specifies time to wait before reattempting query.

env.name: STREAM_ID_RETRY_ATTEMPTS
env.description: Specifies how many queries attempt to perform after the first one failed.

env.name: STREAM_ID_CORE_POOL_SIZE
env.description: The number of threads to keep in the pool, even if they are idle.

env.name: STREAM_ID_MAX_POOL_SIZE
env.description: The maximum number of threads to allow in the pool.

env.name: STREAM_ID_QUEUE_CAPACITY
env.description: The capacity of the queue.

env.name: CN_BROWSE_OPTIMIZATION_ENABLED
env.description: Defines if call-number browse optimization is enabled or not

env.name: SEARCH_QUERY_TIMEOUT
env.description: The maximum time to wait for search query response

env.name: MAX_BROWSE_REQUEST_OFFSET
env.description: The maximum elasticsearch query offset for additional requests on browse around

env.name: REINDEX_LOCATION_BATCH_SIZE
env.description: Defines number of locations to retrieve per inventory http request on locations reindex process

env.name: MAX_SEARCH_BATCH_REQUEST_IDS_COUNT
env.description: Defines maximum batch request IDs count for searching consolidated items/holdings in consortium

env.name: REINDEX_MERGE_RANGE_SIZE
env.description: The range size that represents the number of merge entities to process during the Merge process of reindex

env.name: REINDEX_UPLOAD_RANGE_SIZE
env.description: The range size that represents the number of upload entities to process during the Upload process of reindex

env.name: REINDEX_UPLOAD_RANGE_LEVEL
env.description: The level of deepness of upload range generator affecting the number of ranges to be generated

env.name: REINDEX_MERGE_RANGE_PUBLISHER_CORE_POOL_SIZE
env.description: The number of threads for publishing the merge ranges to keep in the pool, even if they are idle.

env.name: REINDEX_MERGE_RANGE_PUBLISHER_MAX_POOL_SIZE
env.description: The maximum number of threads for publishing the merge ranges to allow in the pool.

env.name: REINDEX_MERGE_RANGE_PUBLISHER_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS
env.description: The retry interval in ms for reindex merge range request publishing.

env.name: REINDEX_MERGE_RANGE_PUBLISHER_RETRY_ATTEMPTS
env.description: The maximum number of retries for reindex merge range request publishing.
